name: Berlin Marriott Hotel

reviews.title: Soulless and expensive
reviews.text: The Marriott is fine as it goes but essentially it is a soulless concrete box (albeit a luxury concrete box). Nothing to grumble about and many business travellers will find it fine.
The previous reviews on hear say it all - a luxury comfotable hotel with all the facilites you need in a superb location.

reviews.text: My short stay in Berlin was perfect experience thanks to Marroitt hotel. I was there on business and did not have much time for tourist activities and the weather was rather bad for that time of the year. However, the hotel experience was fantastic. The location of the hotel is perfect, close to some of the main attractions. Everything else - room, cleanliness, amenities - was perfect. Service is first class, just what you expect from a Marriott hotel. If I have to choose something on the down side, I would say that breakfast is not really a five star one, but it is was good. All in all, would recommend and would go there again.
reviews.title: Excellent!

reviews.text: Fantastic Hotel in a brilliant location. Just returned from 6 nights staying at this superb hotel. The hotel was immaculate and in a great location close to the Sony Centre and the Brandenburg Gate with all other locations just so handy to get to using the underground across the road. Paid a little extra to gain access to the executive lounge so could have internet access but was worth every penny for all the extra benefits that gave us. A lovely welcome gift on arrival, fresh fruit in our room everyday and complimentary breakfast in the exec lounge. Snacks and nibbles were also available during the day and each evening drinks and cocktails and hot and cold snacks all free of charge. Felt like a private members club where each evening we all met for drinks before going out and then called back in for a nightcap before bed. Just ate far to many peanut M & M s though. Would return to this hotel everytime visited Berlin. Word of caution about Berlin though.....amazed how many department stores and shops and restaurants dont take credit cards.....take plenty of cash
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel in a fab city

likes.liked: — Loved the cleanliness, executive lounge and location

reviews.text: I can't recommend this hotel highly enough. Its location is very convenient - next to Potsdamerplatz and near to the Brandenburg Gate, the Reichstag, the Tiergarten and the Berlin Philharmonic. Everything in my room was of the very highest quality, and new - it looked like I was the first person to stay there. The bar is comfortable and accommodating, the breakfast room is light and well staffed. The staff were helpful and courteous.
reviews.title: Luxury and Convenience

likes.liked: — Everything was high quality, well looked after and very comfortable.
likes.disliked: — The breakfast was not competitively priced.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked this hotel on the basis of my previous (good) experiences of Marriott hotels, and was not disappointed. When I go back to Berlin (as I must) I will stay here without bothering to scout for other hotels - it was that good.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.text: For the purposes of comparison I paid EUR159 per night. The breakfast was EUR24, which I felt was a bit on the high side. There is a cafe 100 yards away that will substitute on my next visit.
reviews.title: absolutely fantastic

reviews.text: What else: super nice beds, elegant bathrooms, individual airconditioning, floor to ceiling windows, but no noice from the street, actually the room in the 10th floor was very silent also otherwise: we slept well and late . In front of the hotel there were taxies waiting all the time, and also metro/train stations very close.

reviews.text: Even if the new centre of Berlin is still shaping up (lot of contruction going on), I liked the location more than Kurfürstendam. (Sony Center was a bit dissappointing, though). One can walk to main sights in the Unter den Linden area etc.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel - hope to go back one day

reviews.text: Very good hotel. Luxurious and close to the city center. A lot can be done walking. From the Sony Center to the Parliament and the Brandenburger Tor. Location is perfect. We did not realize this, untill we started walking from the Hotel and found we were near the sites...

reviews.title: A piece of heaven in Berlin
Excellent Marriot
reviews.text: I stayed at the Marriot with my wife for a weekend mid January and found it difficult to fault. We booked a room on the executive floor on the hotels website and this turned out to be one of the best weekend deals of all the internet deals for top Berlin Hotels. The hotel is right on Potsdammer Platz, next to the Sony Center and a plesant 5 minute walk through the park to Reichtag and Brandenburg Gate (the start of Under van Linden).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are a reasonable size and our King size bed one of the most comfortable I've ever experienced. Service was friendly and very efficient (even by efficient German standards), the pool and sauna area small but it has everything you need. In general the hotel has a cosy feel considering it's really designed for business. The only reason I've given this four stars and not five were two relatively minor complaints. The pool water is slightly on the cold side and the 40 channel televison only has four English speaking channels, three of them news channels plus Eurosport. The latter "complaint" should be easy to fix and may even encourage guests to use the hotel room service more.
reviews.title: Heavenly bed in a very good hotel

likes.disliked: — bottom and lower back unfriendlt chairs

reviews.text: As far as we could see, all the rooms are of a similar standard (the hotel is purpose built and only a couple of years old) but booking an executive room gives you a room on the top floor (better view and direct lift to the health club) and access to the comfortable and well equipped executive lounge which supplies the breakfast buffet and hot and cold snacks and drinks (including alcoholic drinks) throughout the day. Note that if you DON'T eat breakfast in the lounge, they'll charge you extra either for room service or the restaurant, but this didn't give us a problem at all.
reviews.title: Loved the Marriott, Berlin

reviews.text: The bed designer deserves a medal, just heaven.Standard rooms(deluxe) are very comfortable although the chairs are not for those sitting a long time,very good bathrooms and mostly attentative staff.Also a well fitted health club, pool and an overall feel of cleanliness throughout.Excellant postion next to Potzdammer Platz with a direct bus to the main station and 10 mins walk to the Reichstag and Brandenburg Gate. There is an excellant (German mini chain) Italian restaurant next door, Viander plus a Balzac Coffee shop within 100 yrds. For those going to Potsdam for the Palaces the Train goes from this station with a change at Wansee, also 1 change from SXF airport. Berlin has really good public transport and we purchased 3 day tickets at EUR22 at the airport which was a very good investment as they took us to Potsdam and back to the airport. One place not to be missed is the Charlottenberg Palace especially the 'New' Wing, there was little or no info on it and even our concierge knew really nothing of it, easy u bahn and bus ride. Overall a great place to be both Marriott and Berlin!!
reviews.title: Be aware , its good really good !!

reviews.text: Just returned from a fantastic week in the Berlin Marriott, with our 5 yr old daughter upon arrival the Concierge gave her a Marriott Teddy Bear which was a nice touch. The hotel is set right in the middle of the Potsdamer Platz, across the road from the famous "Sony Centre" with excellent transport links around the city.
reviews.title: Cold!!!

reviews.text: Stayed here for a couple of nights initially and then extended. Didn't really want to go home again. The staff was top class, very friendly and patient (not very common in Germany). A huge room with a great bathroom. The bed was heavenly and the breakfast perfect. Very central and still quiet location! You can walk right into the Tiergarten park and it's a very short pleasant walk to the Brandenburg Gate, parliament etc.
reviews.title: Great stay! Top location, staff, rooms!

reviews.text: I stayed at a business suite for a week in last February. Words cannot describe the experience. View over the city was amazing. Bed was heavenly. Room was huge. Bathroom was enormous. Breakfast was magnificent. Perfect.
reviews.title: Best hotel ever

reviews.text: I considered stayioing at the Swisshotel or the Marriott but chose the latter simply because it had some great reviews on this website; it was located next to the Sony Centre with excellent connectivity; and the Executive Club lounge rate was cheaper than the one offered by Swissotel.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: My stay in this hotel was from 24th - 27th August 2006 on the Executive Floor. It was excellent - friendly staff, good food and great locality. This is one of the better Marriott hotels and I would recommend any one looking at this website to seriously consider this hotel. Access to the executive club lounge was actually very good. If you go on business or pleasure you can entertain guests there, and with family stock your daily needs (especially drink).
reviews.title: Simply the Best

likes.liked: — Cleanliness and quality of all the furniture and fittings

reviews.text: This is a very pleasant hotel and so solidly built that you can't hear noise from other guests or the traffic outside, a quality I really enjoy when sleeping in a strange city. The location is great, the food not bad, but I was disappointed to smell cigarette smoke in the public spaces. My room smelled distinctly of smoke although I requested a non-smoking room. They do things differently in Europe, where the anti-smoking laws are sadly laxer than in Canada.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, shame about the smoke

reviews.text: One of the very best Marriotts I have stayed at and I like the chain anyway. It's a very modern hotel with a lively atmosphere. Located right next to Potsdamer Platz and Sony Center it's an excellent place to stay if you're in Berlin as tourist with a lot of sights within walking distance.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: Stayed for two nights - great room! So clean, great front desk staff and bar staff. Located near the Potsdamer Platz train station and the bus tours. We loved it. Cafes, coffee shops within walking distance as well.
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.text: As a frequent traveller, I'm quite particular hotels. So when I say that this is a great hotel, that means something. In terms of tourism, it's well situated, only a 5 min walk from the Brandenburg Gate. It's very well run and has a good fitness area. Very good Feng Shui layout, contemporary but not elegant. Great value for the money.
reviews.title: One of Berlin's best value premium hotels

reviews.text: I have been at the hotel for a week during the Berlin Film Festival. Room is a junior suite. It has a separate, spacious living room with t.v., desk, sofa and chair. The living room has floor to ceiling windows on two sides. Bedroom is large. Bed is the most comfortable I have ever slept in! Large bathroom with marble floors with long but narrow tub, glass shower and single sink. What makes this hotel a stand out is the service. They are at full capacity due to the Festival but still every request is met with instant response. Having a suite gives access to the club lounge on the 10th floor where breakfast is available every morning and hot food, wines, cheeses and irresistable pastries served in the evenings. Location is great, round the corner from the (much more expensive) Ritz. Highly recommend this hotel for business and also family travel.
reviews.title: Service is second to none!

reviews.text: Very impressed from the moment we checked-in. Staff were very efficient. Room was large and spotless. Great choice at breakfast, everyone catered for.

reviews.text: The location was very central, right near Brandenberg Tor and with the Sony Centre on the doorstep.
reviews.title: The Marriott is GREAT

reviews.text: Would not hesitate to recommend and re-visit.
reviews.title: 21st Century Berlin

reviews.text: I had decided on the Berlin Marriott over the Courtyard due to the excellent reviews on Tripadvisor. I made the correct choice. The hotel is beautiful, rooms extremely large and well appointed. What I really liked is that the windows in the room could be opened to get fresh air. The location can not be beat for walking to all the tourist sites and for great restaurants. It is right at Potsdamer Platz and their are buses and subways practically at the door. Also, even though in the middle of the city the hotel is really quiet. When I go back to Berlin I will return to the Berlin Marriott.
reviews.title: Marriott Hotel

reviews.text: I stayed here for 3 nights with my wife and three children. We had two adjoining rooms. It is a beautifully appointed space with all the luxuries of a 4+ star hotel. It is located in the center of town with all public transportation readily available. Berlin is a fascinating city representing the Europe of the new century. The Marriott is a great spot to take it all in. Once again I will say you can rely on the Marriott brand.
reviews.title: First-class hotel & value for money
Nice Hotel
reviews.text: The Marriott Berlin is a nice modern hotel. The hotel is conveniently located at Potsdamer Platz. It's a short walk to the Reichstag and Brandenburger Tor. Subway station is a block from the hotel which provided convenient access to other parts of Berlin.

Rooms were decent size. I had a nice view of the city. Beds were very comfortable and bathroom was nicely appointed. Lobby and common areas were clean and nicely maintained. Pool/workout area is decent size and well maintained.
reviews.title: Superb!

reviews.text: Concierce staff was very helpful and friendly.

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for two nights. The hotel exceeded our expectations. We found the service and location to be excellent. The room was a good size and comfortable. The only meal we ate in the hotel was breakfast which was fine but not exceptional. We would certainly be happy to use the Marriott again on a future visit to Berlin.
reviews.title: An excellent experience
Good, American hotel
reviews.text: Booked this on priceline for $90USD. Significantly lower than even 3 star hotels in central Berlin.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself is lovely and service is good. With that said, it's like a little slice of America right in the middle of Berlin complete with ice machines. How novel.
reviews.title: Good value for your money...

reviews.text: Our first room was slightly strange, however, with hardwood floors and no area rug. I say our first room because on our first morning we were awoken by what sounded like someone drilling in our room. When we called "At Your Service", their customer service line, we were told they were doing construction. 20 minutes later and 2 calls back, I was told that they were changing our rooms. We were upgraded to an executive level floor which was different only in the sense that it had carpeting and it was quiet. Don't pay extra for them.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

likes.liked: — The Beds if I had to say one thing, but loved it all

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location: Right across the street from the Ritz Carlton and within walking distance of the Brandenburg Gate. Because we went during Christmas time, there was a lovely Christmas market outside our doors and a late afternoon Gluhwein was much appreciated when we got off the U-bahn after a long day out and about. With this said, Potsdamer Platz is not all that great. If we were to do this again, I wouldn't think twice about booking the Sofitel, Westin or Hilton because of their location in Gendarmmarkt.
reviews.title: terrific location, great hotel, great service

description: The Berlin Marriott Hotel is located at the Potsdamer Platz. The hotel is within walking distance to several Berlin sightseeing highlights, such as the Brandenburg Gate and Sony Center in Berlin.
